topics.name: Mathematics
topics.description: Explore mathematical concepts through guided inquiry

subtopics.name: Calculus
guiding_questions: What does it mean for a function to change?
How can we measure instantaneous change?
What is the relationship between area and accumulation?

subtopics.name: Algebra
guiding_questions: What patterns do you notice in these expressions?
How can we represent unknown quantities?
What happens when we manipulate both sides equally?

topics.name: Programming
topics.description: Learn programming concepts through logical reasoning

subtopics.name: Algorithms
guiding_questions: What is the simplest case of this problem?
How would you solve this for a very small input?
What patterns emerge as the input grows?

subtopics.name: Data Structures
guiding_questions: How do we organize information for efficient access?
What trade-offs exist between different structures?
When would you choose one structure over another?

topics.name: Science
topics.description: Discover scientific principles through observation and reasoning

subtopics.name: Physics
guiding_questions: What do you observe about how objects move?
What causes change in motion?
How is energy transferred between systems?

subtopics.name: Biology
guiding_questions: What are the basic units of life?
How is information passed between generations?
How do living things interact with their environment?

topics.name: Philosophy
topics.description: Engage in critical thinking and logical analysis

subtopics.name: Logic
guiding_questions: What makes an argument valid?
How do we distinguish good reasoning from bad?
What assumptions are you making?

subtopics.name: Ethics
guiding_questions: What do you believe is the right thing to do?
How do we decide between competing values?
What principles guide ethical decision-making?

principles: Ask questions rather than provide answers
Guide students to discover knowledge themselves
Build on what the student already knows

question_types.description: Questions that ask students to explain their thinking
examples: What do you mean by that?
Can you give me an example?
How would you explain this in your own words?

question_types.description: Questions that dig deeper into reasoning
examples: Why do you think that is true?
How does this relate to what we discussed earlier?
Can you see any patterns here?
What are the implications of this?
What would happen if that weren't true?
Can you think of a counterexample?
How would someone disagree with this?
